poem:
Late to the Listen

In the quiet morning,  
the whales hum through static,  
while Bella spins threads of fashion,  
childhood echoes on the waves of sound.  

Newsprint folds into corners—  
a fortnight's pause,  
words held in the wings,  
in wait.  

I sip my coffee,  
and catch the tail end  
of stories, drifting.
